result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carey Wayne Morris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carey Wayne Morris appeared by video.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Carey Wayne Morris. 
 Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense intends to file a Stop Motion and request a briefing scheduling.
Court ordered defense to file motion by 11-30-2022 and Motion hearing date will be determine on that date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will via zoom.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

HELD OFF THE RECORD
Defendant Carey Wayne Morris in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Carey Wayne Morris.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer needs more time to review with client.
Defense request a Scheduling conference date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 by zoom.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Carey Wayne Morris in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 06CF4944. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer R. Clementz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Carey Wayne Morris
Current: 3846 N Port Washington Rd, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 08-01-2022)
Prior: 1805 West Monroe Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205

Defendant Carey Wayne Morris in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Carey Wayne Morris in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carey Wayne Morris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
